website_summaries.verdict: The wire-free B&O Play Beoplay E8 earphones deliver high-quality Bluetooth audio and an app that allows you to set your EQ preferences, but feel a bit overpriced.
pros: Powerful audio performance with deep bass and crisp highs
cons: Transparency mode can be confusing before adjustments are made

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic B&O quality kit.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic B&O build quality, excellent sound, classy look and finish, easily links to phone and B&O app. Highly recommend if you’re in the £250 market. Went for a 10K run in them this morning and they worked fine, no dropping and didn’t fall out and I forgot they were in my ears.
customer_reviews.author: J. McGlynn

customer_reviews.title: Worst B & O product ever made by them!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I know some reviewers say these are great,unfortunately I’m not one of them.For a B & O product these are the worst,if I’m turning my head to either side the right earbud loses connection and as for the bass there isn’t any,even if you download the app and adjust the equaliser it’s still rubbish.i have sent these back to amazon and have now got the Bose ones which are Brilliant and cost £70 cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: ANDY

customer_reviews.title: So far so good - UPDATED 24 hours later
customer_reviews.text: Paired easily and thus far no drop outs which is great, sound quality is good and tap functionality all works with my Iphone, MacBook and Mac. These are not noise cancelling hence the score down on that, but there is talk through function which works well. Gutted, the left earbud ceased to work after 24 hours, spoke with B&O customer support, tried everything as suggested to no avail and am returning these as faulty. Will save a bit more and perhaps look to get a later version at some point as I do like them. I have however gone from a 5* to a one as they have ceased to work after 24 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Andy P

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother. Buy something else.
customer_reviews.text: Bought new 3 days ago. I don't know about sound quality or volume or anything else because I CANT GET THEM TO CONNECT. I see from the reviews I'm not the only one so it's not because I'm too thick to get them to work. Hours wasted. So disappointed as I assumed B&O was the dogs b......s. I'm sending mine back and going back to my apple airpods which actually work. B&O please address the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t be tempted by large discount !!!
customer_reviews.text: Probably a knee jerk reaction purchasing these earbuds when I saw the discount. Are they worth the money ? I would say borderline or if I could turn back time I would have done more research and possibly not purchased them. They are niggly and the sound quality depends on how they sit in your ear which isn’t always the most comfortable. My kids laughed when I wore them saying they look ridiculous compared to apple pods. Overall I expected more from B&O but since I purchased I will use but again shop around and possibly do for the Cambridge buds (which wasn’t an option for me as they don’t deliver to Ireland)
customer_reviews.author: Ronan

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant headphones for £85, just make sure you get the right fit earbud!
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you buy some comply tips which fit well and these headphones are brilliant! An absolute bargain for the price. The left headphone doesn’t connect via Bluetooth, instead it links wirelessly using the same tech as hearing aids to the right headphone, which means it does occasionally drop out momentarily, but this is very excusable given the quality and now low price. Battery case is sleek. Note: if you get the comfort comply tips the headphones won’t snap into the case as easily, so give them a little push to make sure they’re charging ok!
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: These turned out to be rather disappointing. They are at the highest end of pricing across comparable products. They feel nice and the case is just fantastic however the real measure is how they perform as headphones and frankly that is the weakest part of the product. They do not stay in ear regardless of which size tip is used. they leak in an obscene amount of background noise, i think because they are always on their way falling out your ear. I would recommend the Bose alternative, they are a solid £100 cheaper and frankly a far better product
customer_reviews.author: Mikeyvegas

customer_reviews.title: Great product and customer service
customer_reviews.text: Good product but can’t give better than a1 star review as casing joint failed after 8 months. Will give a five star if I get a satisfactory supplier response. Update. Instant response from Amazon. Refund given and will immediately buy another pair as they are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Terrible connection wonderful sound seems old technology
customer_reviews.text: What a wonderful pair of earphones but totally rubbish connection. The strength of the connection is woeful making listening on the move bity and interference full. However if you have the phone close like with old bluetooth sound is fantastic the controls with soft touch is different but the bluetooth technology feels a little dated
customer_reviews.author: slybauer

customer_reviews.title: They sound great but
customer_reviews.text: I cant fault the sound, comfort or battery life, so the perfect pair of earbuds right? no not at all, they are a nightmare to connect to anything, I have spent up to 20 mins trying to connect them on occasions and this is the same for apple, android, echo etc etc. B & O can clearly make great earbuds but they are way behind when it comes to the software side of things, such a shame because they could be great but the connection problems ruin the experience.
customer_reviews.author: Steve jp

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Bang & Olufsen sound in a tiny package.
customer_reviews.text: This is another incredible product from Bang & Olufsen. The discounted price only enhanced the buying experience. This is a quality product, with sound for the discerning B&O-lover and would probably not suit those looking for constant thudding bass. The case is well made and the battery life more than adequate. Bluetooth connection has also been excellent. I've used this product now for a couple of months and have no complaints at this stage. I sincerely hope that B&O will continue to build on this level of product for upgrades and updates, and that they do not start cutting corners for profit over quality as happens with so many other other companies.
customer_reviews.author: Nomad

customer_reviews.title: Superb product for a 1st timer
customer_reviews.text: My 1st set of ear pods, build quality and the price point is to be expected of bang and Olufsen, and whilst wearing them you know there in and working, but no weight so no no ear fatigue to speak of, this coming from someone who usually wears over the ear Sony Bluetooth headphones, the sound quality is lacking from what I'm used too, bit for sheer portability these things are brilliant, not like I can fit my extra beefy oversized headphones in a case in my chest pocket! If your looking for a good and solid product, invest in these or the MKT model
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Kept loosing blue tooth connection -
customer_reviews.text: First the positives - they looked great and the charging/storage case are nicely designed. Now the negatives - the blue tooth pairing kept cutting out. I'd be listening to an album and sound would continually drop out - it reminded me of a CD (remember them) skipping. Sound was OK but lacked bass - I expected much better from B&O. I bought them for when I was out walking but I continually had to keep pushing them back in. These are all things other reviewer have written - should have researched a little more before making this purchase - was sad to return them as got them at a bargain £120 on Prime Day. The search goes on....
customer_reviews.author: Dazz96

customer_reviews.title: Won’t connect
customer_reviews.text: As some of the reviews are saying the quality of sound, when you can get these to work is unmatched. Unfortunately mine kept losing the connection when I took them out of the case and eventually I could not get them to connect with my iPhone 7 at all. I am so fed up but at this price and for the amount of time I’ve spent trying to get them to connect they are just not worth the price. I even went in to a B&O shop locally and the guy there even said that I should send them back and as he couldn’t get them to pair either.
customer_reviews.author: peacelily

customer_reviews.title: Serious issues..
customer_reviews.text: I feel compelled to write a review of these. They look great. They feel great. They sound great. One problem, the connection on these buds is appaling. If I even tried to put my phone in my front jeans pocket, the sound would begin to break up. This renders them utterly unusable. Sadly I have sent them back. I so wanted these to work. Perhaps the next gen will be worth buying, but these certainly aren't particularly at this price. Pity.
customer_reviews.author: S. C. Lovell

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant but don't use in the gym!
customer_reviews.text: I really liked these headphones. The sound quality was great, the fit was superb and didn't really jut out of your ears, although leaving them in for too long could be painful. I used them everywhere, including the gym (which was one of the sole reasons I bought these, as they were wireless) but after just 7 months of use. The right ear bud stopped transmitting sound. Bit disappointed as I expected them to be more rugged rather than break with a little bit of sweat on them but hey ho, if you use them for commuting this will be a fine product (although the price is extortionate).
customer_reviews.author: DeWae

customer_reviews.title: Consider something else with better sound for the money.
customer_reviews.text: They’re certainly not worth the money, sound quality isn’t as great as I’d expect from something this price. You are definitely just paying for the name. 1st pair I ordered were faulty, amazon replaced via return, very well. 2nd pair worked better but disappointed with the sound. They hold well in ear, the build seems good but the buttons don’t always work and every so often I get a drop in sound while listening to music, like changing the station on a radio.
customer_reviews.author: N. Rankin

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: Nice product. Good sound quality and nice looking. Reasonably comfortable. Looked at lots of alternatives I’m noise cancelling ranges and couldn’t decide. These do the job. Bit irritating that don’t have built in charger like Jlab. Also not the easiest to pair with Bluetooth and you need to download app which frankly doesn’t do a lot in terms of sound options. If I wasn’t bothered about sound quality or brand I would go with cheaper products which do similar job but sound quality is definitely better.
customer_reviews.author: Fine

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Completely useless. The whole point of “true” wireless earbuds is that the Bluetooth connection actually works. The Bluetooth connection is extremely intermittent at times. Defeats the point of the earbuds in the first place. The connection should be perfect for the high price. Very disappointed with B&O(a supposedly high end brand) DO NOT BUY. 0 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Brian O' Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Style over function
customer_reviews.text: The styling and sound quality is good, but despite the multiple plug sizes they come with, they just do not fit well in the ears, particularly if you’re exercising; they’ll often just fall out. Also the touch controls are very sensitive and have a slight delay, so again, if you’re using them when exercising it’s not great; you want a more positive touch so you can be sure you don’t nudge them accidentally when adjusting the fit. I wouldn’t buy them again. Go for AirPods or something of that shape if you want to exercise with earphones.
customer_reviews.author: Fane

customer_reviews.title: B&O earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I don’t normally leave reviews, basically because I’m too lazy but in this case I’m going to because I’m so impressed with these headphones. I use them for mountain biking in extremely rough terrain and they don’t fall out, ever. The sound quality I would say is extremely good for an ear bud headphone and they can blank out pretty much all other noise. The different size ear buds help you get a proper fit and are as comfortable as can be expected considering you’re stuffing something into your ear hole. I can’t imagine what Apple could be offering at twice the price that would make me switch. Well done B&O
customer_reviews.author: Pat McG

customer_reviews.title: A solid good... But not great.
customer_reviews.text: I have had these earphones for a month now, and they are very good. Simple to setup and control whilst doing simple workouts at the gym or being on-the-go. However, I would only ever have paid the sale price for them. £120.00 is the maximum I'd allow for these. Any more and I'd be putting them up against the Sennheiser Momentum earphones, which are just better in every way! B&O really have improved upon the quality of their earphones with these and the 2.0, but as recently as today, both earphones have started to phase out of bluetooth sync for no apparent reason at all, and have taken a good 5-6 tries at re-syncing to actually reconnect to my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lovely Sound
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up without downloading the app. App is useful for changing the sound for different types of music. Plenty of choice of earphone covers to get the correct fit. Only used a few times and really enjoy using them. I have set up for use with my phone and my laptop. I have used them for listening to music and Audible for books. Very happy with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: SAJO

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: After trying several types or true wireless earphones,I must say i was pleasantly impressed by these. Sound quality is great,very clean trebles and the sound can be modified just by changing earbuds, I compare them to a very good pair of wired headphones. Very qualitative materials too which can be crucial given the kind of product. Happily surprised
customer_reviews.author: TeK Nik

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Audio
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with these. I got the 1st gen ones at a great price (think they’re up to third get now, and 3 times the price of mine). The only reason I’ve scored 1 star for noise cancellation is that they’re NOT noise cancelling. There’s a degree of passive cancellation because they’re actually in-ear, but they haven’t been designed (and don’t claim) to be noise cancelling. Sound quality is amazing - hearing new things in old familiar songs that I’ve never heard on other high quality speakers and ear phones.
customer_reviews.author: Dod Ross

customer_reviews.title: Defective and over-priced
customer_reviews.text: had to send it back after 2 months, since the right earpiece stopped working. The device turned out to be defective and I received a replacement after 2 weeks. After 3 weeks with the replacement device, the exact same issue started occuring again. I will get it replaced another time and sell it on to get more reliable headphones. Sound quality is decent, but failed to convince me, especially given the relatively high price point. Battery does not last very long.
customer_reviews.author: Filip Hoffmann-Häußler

customer_reviews.title: Terrible connectivity. Youll spend most your time trying to connect them again and again
customer_reviews.text: Good sound quality. But I would definitely not buy again. The Bluetooth connectivity and B&O app are completely not fit for purpose. Have to connect manually every time I turn them on. Then sometimes it loses connectivity so you have to do a factory reset, remove headphones from the app and add them again to make it connect. This doesn't work first time so you have to try again and again.
customer_reviews.author: Connor628

customer_reviews.title: Good but complex, irritating Bluetooth Control
customer_reviews.text: I very much like the sound quality; however, the design of the bluetooth control needs to be simplified. Why have "one press" to turn the thing on, then "press and hold both" to activate bluetooth. You cannot use the thing without bluetooth, so why have the first step?? That said, once you have mastered this weirdness, the connection is quite robust and even survives a headphone being dropped on the floor and still plays. Even with a Black-Friday discount, this is an expensive item - bought on impulse for my wife's Xmas. Should have gone with Apple, which are similarly-priced but "just work". I find it surprising that B&O do not look at other designs and learn!
customer_reviews.author: Francis G Pole

customer_reviews.title: Had these for a month or so now. Use ...
customer_reviews.text: Had these for a month or so now. Use for either gym, or audio books. They don’t fall out on me. The sound is blinding when you position them correctly and download the beoplay app. I do find the touching for skip, volume etc a little temperamental. I’ve also found they don’t seem to be for everyone’s ears, they don’t fit in my girlfriends ears.
customer_reviews.author: Reiko

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic but cheap construction breaks!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing earbuds which broke after 18 months as the back of left bud fell off. B&O claim it was down to use. They get worn only while in work sitting at a desk. Don’t buy their 24 month warranty is not worth the Paper it’s written on. Spend your money on a better made product, these don’t last long enough for the money. Huge range with no dropout even in business premises. I’m in love with the social mode! Can now tailor the sound level to block out distractions without being cut off from essential conversations and can get on with my work. This is brilliant! Transparency mode rocks!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher D.

customer_reviews.title: B&O No No!
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing - poor bass response even using the equaliser on Spotify, distorted poor quality sound. Definitely not worth the money. Only paying for the B&O name. Sent them back. Still to find a good quality sound Bluetooth earphone to replace my great sounding wired Bose ones.
customer_reviews.author: Graeme Hartley

customer_reviews.title: Shame
customer_reviews.text: When they work they sound brilliant , until they stop working or you try to do ANYTHING like change volume / answer a call / ply/stop music then they stop working and you have to mess about for 45 mins trying to reconnect etc . I tried using them the other day and they just would not play , I could change tracks / play etc but no sound . Over all very very poor purely because of all the messing about . Real shame because they look and sound great
customer_reviews.author: chay fallows

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I can't review the quality of sound, as I didn't totally complete the setup! BE AWARE, you CAN'T ACCESS YOUR OWN MUSIC DOWNLOADED ON YOUR PHONE! You can only stream music using the app! This limits you to Deezer and Spotify with a radio. Not impressed! Never have I purchased earphones that aren't capable of accessing music on my phone! This should be made clear before purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Miss K A Butler

customer_reviews.title: They are good, but...!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these buds few days ago, quality/price I think it's just ok. They are built very well, accessories are good and the case is really nice and not too big. My concern is mainly about the functionality of these buds, I think they should work a lot on the app which is poor on options and graphic. Also I figured out after 1 or 2 hours of listening, it hurts a bit my ears, maybe this is my defect but I think I will go for the Bose or the PowerBeats and see how it goes. However, I recommend this item for anyone who likes design and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Stefano Ballone

customer_reviews.title: Huge disappointment - Awful sound
customer_reviews.text: For such a well known brand I was shocked by how poor these were. They looked good in the box, but that was as good as it got. The sound was utterly dreadful - tinny and lacking in any depth whatsoever. To be frank I’ve heard better on airlines when they used to issue free in flight earphones! These have gone straight back for refund. I cannot believe anyone paying £80 would think these were good value for money, and am incredulous to find out they used to sell for over £200!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Premium quality sound and feel
customer_reviews.text: Premium feel and build quality. These are a quality pair of buds with great sound quality, comfortable fit and good noise cancelling features. However the do loose connection when there's too much movement so I wouldn't recommend them for running with. Also they where a little tricky to connection to my Galaxy S20 phone. For some reason they will not connect to Android phones with downloading the app first. Apart from that, an excellent product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Sound
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding earbuds, on the downside it was a struggle to connect but definitely worth it, I had to hold both buds down for 10 secs till the right earbud would flash red and then repair them as a 1 time fix this paired everything together. After pairing I cant fault them cracking earbuds 🤘
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. C. J. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Could not get them to work
customer_reviews.text: People had said that the set up was difficult. I just thought they were techno-nubes and I would have no problems - I've used loads of wireless earphones in the past. But I was completely defeated. After spending loads of time on the chat to Bang and Olufsen we ran out of suggestions and I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Quality and Sound. Avoid close proximity to electric/hybrid engines.
customer_reviews.text: Can't fault these earpods. Beware though.... if you sit at the back of an electric powered bus and you turn your head left or right they will cut out. Face forward and there will be no issues. Or sit away from the engine. I'm guessing this will be the same issue near any hybrid vehicle engine.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Hallworth

customer_reviews.title: If you’re a B&O fan, these are for you!
customer_reviews.text: Simple, effortless connection. Other reviews have said tricky and fiddly to connect, but I never had this difficulty. Sound quality is out of this world even at low volume. Excellent ear fit. I have the over ear wired earphones also, but these are just great for wireless use. Beautiful B&O design - up to their usual standards. Just perfect! Love love love!!!
customer_reviews.author: MsCupcake

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: For the full price of £275, these earbuds don't quite match the level you'd expect. But the sound quality is still perfect, they are super comfortable, they are very easy to use. The transparency mode is a bit funky, but it's still usable, although I find it easier to just pause my music as there is no overlap of music and transparency mode anyways. Another concern is that I seem to be unable to just use the left earbud on its own, maybe someone else can tell me how to fix this? The right earbud is able to be used alone, just not the left. Other than this, the earbuds are still superb and I'm very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SunderlandGamer

customer_reviews.title: Impressed with Beoplay E8! You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing design, comfortable and they fit perfectly. Fantastic neat sound, with quality and great bass. Great tactile features without the need of taking your phone out... specially when the tube is packed! Batteries last decent 3.5-4 hours and the charging case is perfect. Only downside: Not quite happy with phone calls if you are outdoors in the city, as the person on the phone will struggle a little bit to hear you. I use them for what I love and it's music, and after trying other top brands they have no competition.
customer_reviews.author: codeveuq

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy these. The sound quality is amazing, but the PISS POOR Bluetooth connection is not worth the hassle, really, its bad. Cuts out constantly when in your pocket. And after a few montha of ownership, it just progressively gets worse, and B&O support is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Had to send them back as they were faulty. Wouldn't go above say, 30% volume. Sound quality was relatively good but when you can still hear things around you on full volume it makes little difference. I assumed that all of the issues were fixed by updating the firmware after reading online but it didn't fix anything. B&O said it was a faulty pair so send them back. I bought a pair of Cambridge Melomania's for less money and they are miles better. Same sound quality and better fitting for me too.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for Samsung galaxy mobile phone
customer_reviews.text: I honestly thought that i was getting a bargain by purchasing these earbuds for a knockdown price. How wrong was i to believe that!!! These earbuds are not compatible with Samsung Android phones. The volume level is awful, the bass and treble is terrible, noise cancellation is non existant. Very disappointed with this purchase and already on their way back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Gutted
customer_reviews.text: I'm gutted. I knew it was too good to be true at the reduced price tag. No bass whatsoever. Tinny and no volume. Just an awful disappointment. I feel a bit annoyed because now I have to go to the Post Office and queue to return the horrid things. Booo!
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Mc

customer_reviews.title: Poor connectivity
customer_reviews.text: Everything other than connection is great. They loose connectivity when on the move (bike ride etc). I will give them a further charge and test before I make my mind up, to return. Not sure if it's because I have a S9 phone.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Doohan

customer_reviews.title: Very poor product
customer_reviews.text: Very poor as unable to sync left and right EarPods and then unable to resync to phone after this. I was able to get the right EarPods working within a few minutes but unable to get the left EarPods working. After a few hours of reading about issues with left EarPods and watching vids on syncing I was still unable to get them both working. Then after doing all the rebooting of both devices and clearing out me other bluetooth devices on iPhone I was then unable to get any EarPods connected. I would expect a simple plug and play process without any tech issues; sent back same day I received.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Not great for me I'm afraid
customer_reviews.text: As per other reviewers, I had trouble connecting to them, but called the B&O helpline who were great, and got my earphones connected to my phone. The problem is that my Iphone 6 wasn't connecting to them very well, and the sound kept getting interrupted. However, this may be a problem with my old(!) phone as they did connect to my other phone / my partner's phone. They also kept coming out of my ears ( having tried all the different sized covers ), so, unfortunately, I had to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Same as everyone else - terrible software and pairing
customer_reviews.text: Thought long and hard about getting them, as the reviews are pretty bad, but eventually made the jump. Everyone is right. Sound good, nice case etc. BUT Terrible tech, software, pairing. Kinda shocking in this day and age. My AirPods and Jabra were much better. How on earth haven’t they managed to fix this despite the updates. Don’t buy - wait for next gen beoplay as these are no where near worth the price tag. Only saving grace is they sound better than competition. But really not worth all the issues.
customer_reviews.author: MR A SNOWDEN

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed, I hoped the name would set the standard sadly not
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult to use controls are odd and they kept falling out for price and the name ‘ I definitely would recommend. Infact if amazon would refund mine I would be a great full customer . I total owe that on the prestige of the brand , this was a mistake . I dine was given a cheap pair for £15 and they work great and do not fall out all the time ‘
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Don’t turn on
customer_reviews.text: It is a complete lottery as to whether they turn on when take out of case. So frustrating Have to keep Putting back in, taking out repeat ad infinitum sometimes Not good enough For this money should not be thinking will they won’t they this time So many times now have had to go without as cannot get them turned on
customer_reviews.author: Ant

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding...
customer_reviews.text: ...experience. Not that good with the rubber plugs but foam ones, OMG, these are perfect. You will be completely isolated from outside world. Sound is fabulous. Now I hearing tones which I never hear before. Almost sound excellence! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Boros

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous looking with connection issues
customer_reviews.text: The left ear occasionally drops out and back in a second. Although it’s not a true drop out, it’s absolutely noticeable. It’s annoying, but they look so cute...sound quality is way better than apple’s. I don’t like the gesture control since it’s so easy to get messed up with hairs and other movements around your head.
customer_reviews.author: Qing

customer_reviews.title: Better then airpods!!
customer_reviews.text: Better quality and far superior sound over the apple airpods. Had airpods for over a year now and the sound kept muffling so took the pricey jump to these. Quality is much better and the sound is class the only niggle i have is the touchpad is abit poor and doesnt respond as you want it to. Double tap to skip track and it actually pauses then you have to get your phone out to play the song. Probably would of been better to have a physical button rather then a touchpad. Other then that defo worth a purchase
customer_reviews.author: josh parfitt

customer_reviews.title: Wow!!
customer_reviews.text: A product as high in quality as you would expect from B&O, not sure if the people that were having technical difficulties aren't too bright!? Easy to install/pair and brilliant sound. This product is worth every penny...
customer_reviews.author: Ian A.

customer_reviews.title: uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with these especially for the money and immediately sent them back after trying them once running. The earphones were incredibly uncomfortable and kept dropping out. Replaced them with an amazing product.
customer_reviews.author: D M Campbell-Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Beoplay
customer_reviews.text: I found them very easy to connect to iPhone and my iPad . Good quality sound . It took me a few attempts to find the right size ear piece . You have a selection with item These are my first set of ear bubs and would recommend
customer_reviews.author: J. P. Ponder

customer_reviews.title: All round good
customer_reviews.text: These are a great pair of wireless earphones, however I was disappointed by the software decrease in levels of allowing environmental noise in. For passive devices, the noise cancellation is superb. Sound is great but does curb off quite quickly at the lows, as expected, giving a middle heavy profile - really warm and easy to listen to.
customer_reviews.author: James Barber

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I was keen to buy higher quality earphones in the upper price range. This is undoubtedly a pricey product but it doesnt dissappoint. I was split between these or the Bose wireless version but i found the Bose' bass to be overpowering compared to the B&O and the design didnt feel well in my ears. I was surprised to see the rather lower rating (3.5) on amazon. But having purchased it i would defo recommend it. Feels like high quality material and the sound is amazing. Battery hasnt been a problem either as its continuously charging when im not using it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Yoon

customer_reviews.title: Hard to get working.
customer_reviews.text: These earphones don’t fit my ears well. Even the smallest ends are hard to get in my ears. They are difficult to get working as well. There is a real knack to it. The sound can be really frustrating to get it to come through, but once it does it sounds good. They have a good battery life. Continued.....18 mnths later... I gave up with these a while back. Drove me nuts trying to get them to connect to my phone or iPad. Tried again recently and nothing. I def wouldn’t buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Maddisson Hope

customer_reviews.title: for such a big name - disappointed
customer_reviews.text: What a great name in sound, yet these buds do not live up to the standard I expected. Sound quality is a poor second to wireless ear phones I bought costing less than a quarter of these. Very Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: happy camper

customer_reviews.title: Aweful.
customer_reviews.text: Its hard to review a product that doesnt work. I think this may be down to these being the original, 1st gen version of this product but Im not sure. Followed the instructions, headphones wouldnt enter pairing mode. Spent a total of 3 hours on the internet trying to find someone with the same problem as mine and couldnt find any, presumably because there are 2 newer versoins of this product with similiar or identical issues but different methods of solving. Nothing works 0/10 will be returning these.
customer_reviews.author: craig simon

customer_reviews.title: Let down by poor software and unreliable connectivity
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the materials and build quality is good. Let down by the software. Hit and miss connectivity. Unresponsive and unintuitive ‘tap’ gestures on the earpiece. Had to return these due to too much time spent trying to get them connected
customer_reviews.author: Great Scott

customer_reviews.title: Fatally flawed
customer_reviews.text: Look great, sound great, just don’t work reliably - you’ll be forever trying to get them to stay connected. Also not as comfortable in the ears as many others. I want them to be worth the money but they’re just not
customer_reviews.author: Giles

customer_reviews.title: Average quality
customer_reviews.text: A bit disappointed. A lot of echo, not very comfy to use for long period. Sound ok, but not great. I’m glad I paid 120, as for full price I would be very disappointed. Battery lasts ok.
customer_reviews.author: Renars Gudens

customer_reviews.title: Not reccomend for pairing with andriod
customer_reviews.text: it is really annoying when I use the earphone with an android phone (Huawei p10) as there are various of stupid technical issues, especially when the earphone is running out of the battery. Also, The actual earphone is very round and slippery, I acccidently dropped it for a few time. It might be better if using with IPhone, but the only advantage of this earphone is the sound quality, air pod still “a lot” better interm of convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Wu

customer_reviews.title: Poor audio quality
customer_reviews.text: Ok please don't waste your hard earned money, this is simply style over quality. I have had several headphones/earbuds over the years various brands, Beats, Bose,sennheiser. I was so looking forward to these but was very quickly disappointed, Bluetooth connection jumps regularly, no base, no real volume or sound quality. Ok they look great but wow utter sh#te sound quality. Just my honest opinion.
customer_reviews.author: M A COUTTS

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I did not like these at all..they were not comfortable and kept falling out of my ears. Sound quality was not as good as expected from this well known brand .. I sent them back and had a full refund..
customer_reviews.author: Camillia Jones

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound quality! Beautiful case! I was a bit nervous ordering because I was wondering how big the case would be as I want it to fit comfortably into my trouser pocket... And I was tremendeously reliefed seeing the case is very compact. I love the product and using it every day. Very convenient to take the ear pieces in and out.
customer_reviews.author: Randolph Brogle

customer_reviews.title: Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: As you would expect from b&o, these are magnificent. Comfortable fit, great sound quality, noice cancelling works really well. Going from standard headphones to these is night and day.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Garbage returned as it won’t connect
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t connect to a SamsungS9. Spent 2 hours turning off etc. Etc. Needs an app to connect to Bluetooth. Over complicated. Tried on an S20 as well. Same response. Won’t pair and we you think it has it won’t connect. Just says “you need an app”! For £80 they should just work. I got some Bose ones. More expensive but they connected in 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: M H.

customer_reviews.title: Really like them
customer_reviews.text: Not had them long, connected fine first, was a bit of a faff, second day but been great for following days. Sound fantastic. Not quite as comfortable as Bose quiet in ears, but they are cabled and have active noise cancelling. But have warn them for hours at a go and they are fine, with standard ear piece. Btw, they are reduced at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: Daren L.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and quality.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent headphones in terms of quality and sound my only issue with them is the fact they don't stay in your ears when you're jogging, if you want these headphones for jogging they're not that great. Perfect for sound and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Superb truly wireless headphones
customer_reviews.text: Excellent truly wireless headphones. Had no setup or connectivity issues. Sound is really good. Battery life so far seems to be as promised Bang & Olufsen. No issues with phone calls, clarity seems perfect on both ends. Lag while watching YouTube videos seems minimal, you really have to pay attention to notice. Touch control works very well, although trying to remember the commands reminds me of learning morse code!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: really very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I've been a big fan of B & O for many years, as ususal the quality was exceptional as you would expect but the sound was so disappointing ! the app that can be put on your smart phone did work and was very user friendly but this still did not improve the sound. Maybe I just got a dud pair but sadly there was no bass through the ear phones at all !
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Decent buds
customer_reviews.text: Very good sound quality, very fiddly to connect, left bud runs out after an hour so will give them a few changes to see if they improve.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Great sound when theyre connected . Left ear disconnects a lot then have to reset in the charging case. A product at this price this shouldn’t happen . These seem to be common issues. Unacceptable from a high end brand & product. Don’t buy I’m sure there is much better in this price range
customer_reviews.author: shaneo

customer_reviews.title: Quality in design and sound
customer_reviews.text: Once you work out how to use it. This product has amazing quality and control. It was a joy to discover that you can design your own sound presets. Worth the money. Especially at the Amazon price.
customer_reviews.author: Night Runner

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous, but unfit for purpose
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous sound, good control, nice fit, looks a good price, but.....all no good if the left ear bud constantly drops out. It means you have to soft reset them in the carry case! Ouch! Not really fit for purpose then. This is not finger trouble or someone who is not ‘tech savvy’. So folks they are lovely, but unfortunately I would have to advise you all to avoid
customer_reviews.author: neil reading

customer_reviews.title: look good, shame about the fit.
customer_reviews.text: Not what I would expect of this brand, and they keep falling out of my ears. Great sound if I don't move about too much.
customer_reviews.author: Kinchygib

customer_reviews.title: Good but too many dropout issues.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic headphones but sadly had to send them back!! The sound quality is amazing but sadly due to excessive dropout issues. I returned the item. Seems to be a known issue and if they weren't such a high price.
customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: Decent enough for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as they were reduced in price. Sound is subjective but they sound pretty decent to me and they are comfortable to wear. Case looks nice and easily fits into jeans pocket
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Absolute waste of hard earned money... They consistently do not pair effectively and efficiently. On the odd occasion when I did manage to get them to pair they constantly cut out... I tried to persevere and stupidly overran the return date, but going to try and get refund as they do not perform to the purposes for which they are intended.
customer_reviews.author: alexander murray

customer_reviews.title: Returned them and bought another pair just to give them another go because the sound quality was really great. The second pair had issues with the left ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using B&O hifi and headphones for years. This is the seond pair of Beoplay E8 I bought on Amazon. The first pair had connection issues, the left earphone stops working once in a while. Returned them and bought another pair just to give them another go because the sound quality was really great. The second pair had issues with the left earphone again, the sound keeps dropping off every few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: So so
customer_reviews.text: This product has some good and bad. They do not have the level of noise isolation that I was hoping for and the sound quality was good, but not great, at least to my ears. I returned them fairly soon after I purchased them, as I was expecting to be Wowed, based on other reviews, and I just wasn't. I'm sure they are great for lots of people, but just didn't meet my needs.
customer_reviews.author: MBerger

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the Tube
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could conceal the use of my noise cancellation headphones for use on the London Tube and the noise isolation and transparency modes on this work just great. Also allow me to listen to conversations as I choose. So no more telegraphing the use of expensive headphones.
customer_reviews.author: PDM

customer_reviews.title: Epic sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Had these for about 5 months now.Great sound & quality had no problems pairing to my s7 and lately my new s9+. At first had occasional short drop outs of connection but after 2 firmware updates they work perfectly. Supper quality sound especially with s9 Dolby atoms. Comfortable light and easy to use. I love them use all day at work with a case charge at lunch. Best thing I've purchased this year.
customer_reviews.author: A. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Sent me incomplete and broken item
customer_reviews.text: Getting a bit annoyed with amazon. I purchased it second hand directly from amazon and the earphones came with no sponges or charger. Then to top it all the stuff did not work. Had to send back.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Music to my ears . B&O phenomenal.
customer_reviews.text: I have had B&O for over 40 yrs . They never cease to amaze me . The sound quality of these are phenomenal. The B&O app lets you equalise the sound to your taste . The sound is so real it’s unreal . Wow .
customer_reviews.author: satwant s.

customer_reviews.title: HIghly do not recommend not worth price
customer_reviews.text: On the windy can not hear anything but the wind, the touch feature makes it very hard to change songs and take calls etc, in a noisy area the caller can not hear a thing you say so have to switch back to the phone. Returning this produc with in 2 months of use highly disappointed as the brand highly stood out
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth needs prep
customer_reviews.text: Im a singer songwriter and music is my life, I waited a long while for a new set of earbuds, ill be honest i've had them one day and the bluetooth connection is quite bad, the sound is epic but annoyingly cuts out quite a fair amount, is this the buds or my phone? I've had my phone 4years and its never happened woth other earphones.
customer_reviews.author: shane

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT CONNECT TO SAMSUNG S20
customer_reviews.text: Does not connect to Samsung Galaxy S20. Try all the work arounds on the net. Waste of time
customer_reviews.author: P Coz

customer_reviews.title: Great quality earbuds.
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of earphones. Bluetooth a bit erratic at times, with left bud dropping out and requiring you to angle your head a certain way. The buds were twice rejected by my phone which meant a factory reset of the buds and no problems after that.
customer_reviews.author: Kakowoj

customer_reviews.title: Poor setup
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely rubbish. Could not connect went on several help sites that encountered the same issues. Totally reminded me of why I opted out of B&O hifi and replaced with Sonos. Just to complicated and behind on tech. I was trying to connect to Android phone but found the whole scenario frustrating and disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Dereck fearon

customer_reviews.title: Superb all round!
customer_reviews.text: Live these headphones - have wanted them for a long time so very happy to get them at this great price!!
customer_reviews.author: E. Parry

customer_reviews.title: Great sound if you get the ear fitment correct
customer_reviews.text: 2nd set of these I've purchased (first set failed after three months) much better than the original airpods (but gen2 are better).
customer_reviews.author: Luke Bridgeman

customer_reviews.title: First impressions are pretty good, the charging case is a great size
customer_reviews.text: Had the H5's previously, and am used the the Beoplay volume (which some say is quiet). For me it's the same level of volume as the H5's so didn't have any issues with that. First impressions are pretty good, the charging case is a great size, and had a few drop outs of connection on first few uses, but nothing that's put me off so far.
customer_reviews.author: David Collie

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the reduced price either
customer_reviews.text: These are so bad quality they feel cheap especially the case it does not feel premium at all for a Bang and Olufsen product. I didn’t even bother using the earbuds I sent them straight back. Get the Bang and Olufsen H5 wired Bluetooth earphones they feel more premium than these. No wonder they’ve been reduced by 67%
customer_reviews.author: Shahin Miah

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Using this product on my Apple Watch 4, Windows 10 PC and iPhoneXS. Sound quality is amazing, the only issue is that it will only stay tethered to one device at a time and this is nitpicking to be honest. Intention was to use it for listening to music while running or walking but ended up using it with my PC as well.
customer_reviews.author: Khalid Rasool

product_meta.title: Bang & Olufsen Beoplay E8 Premium Truly Wireless Bluetooth Earphones - Black
product_meta.description:
Colour Name:Black

Upgrade Your Wireless Headphones
Enhance your listening experience as you immerse yourself in pristine Bang & Olufsen Signature Sound with premium Beoplay E8 wireless Bluetooth earphones. These sleek in-ear headphones offer a truly wireless way to listen to music and take calls without getting in the way of your busy, active lifestyle.

Big Sound in a Little Package
Equipped with Bang & Olufsen Signature Sound, these unobtrusive in-ear headphones don’t compromise on sound quality for wireless convenience. Tuned by acclaimed Bang & Olufsen sound engineers, the Beoplay E8 earbuds deliver crisp, clear audio the way your favourite artists intended for it to be heard.

Effortlessly High Tech
Advanced Bluetooth 4.2 with DSP allows for sound tuning, equalization, and gain while the dynamic speaker and electronic transducer of these headphones deliver best-in-class sound quality. These Bluetooth headphones are crafted with Near Field Magnetic Induction (NFMI), an innovative audio streaming technology used in hearing aids that ensures good connection between the two earbuds.

Touch Control
Simply tap these earbuds every time you want to change your tune or answer a call. The intuitive touch interface lets you switch between tracks, take calls, adjust volume, and activate voice command without the need to fumble with your phone or annoying wires. It even lets you activate the handy transparency mode, which quickly and safely reconnects you with ambient noises around you.

Premium Materials
Quality materials such as high-performance Comply Sport memory foam and silicone ear tips ensure that these earbuds provide a secure and comfortable fit and the luxurious leather charging case offers stylish transport. After an initial full charge with four hours of playtime, simply secure the earphones into the case and enjoy two additional on-the-go charges for a total of up to 12 hours.



BOX CONTAINS
1 x B&O PLAY by Bang & Olufsen Beoplay E8 Premium Truly Wireless Bluetooth Earphones
feature_bullets: TRULY WIRELESS: Enjoy superior sound quality and true cord-free convenience with these elegant Bluetooth earbuds. The wireless in-ear design delivers hassle-free listening with no strings attached.

SOUND & STYLE: These small wireless earphones are packed with the Bang & Olufsen Signature Sound and complemented by premium materials and a comfortable fit to create a next-level listening experience.

INTUITIVE TOUCH INTERFACE: Don’t fumble with your phone—the easy touch controls let you take calls, switch tracks, or activate features and voice commands simply by tapping these in-ear wireless headphones.

HIGH-TECH FEATURES: Upgrade to Beoplay E8 earbuds featuring Near Field Magnetic Induction (NFMI) technology for high quality audio streaming, Transparency Mode to stay tuned in to your surroundings and advanced Bluetooth 4.2 with DSP.

CHARGING CASE: Your earbuds will travel securely and stylishly in a genuine leather charging case. After your initial charge of four hours this convenient case provides two additional four-hour charges for on-the-go use.

specifications.Delivery information:: We cannot deliver certain products outside mainland UK ( ). We will only be able to confirm if this product can be delivered to your chosen address when you enter your delivery address at checkout.
